intro: Anaphalis concinna, commonly known as the silverleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and fluffy, white or pale yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Anaphalis concinna is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
